description:
In Nova driver we have the following code:

        # trigger the node deploy
        try:
            icli.call("node.set_provision_state", node_uuid,
                      ironic_states.ACTIVE)
        except (exception.NovaException,               # Retry failed
                ironic_exception.InternalServerError,  # Validations
                ironic_exception.BadRequest) as e:     # Maintenance
            msg = (_("Failed to request Ironic to provision instance "
                     "%(inst)s: %(reason)s") % {'inst': instance['uuid'],
                                                'reason': str(e)})
            LOG.error(msg)
            self._cleanup_deploy(node, instance, network_info)
            raise exception.InstanceDeployFailure(msg)

If exception happens inside _cleanup_deploy, it will hide the original one. excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() should be used here.
title: Cleaning on failed spawn in Ironic driver may override original exception

In Nova driver we have the following code:

        # trigger the node deploy
        try:
            icli.call("node.set_provision_state", node_uuid,
                      ironic_states.ACTIVE)
        except (exception.NovaException,               # Retry failed
                ironic_exception.InternalServerError,  # Validations
                ironic_exception.BadRequest) as e:     # Maintenance
            msg = (_("Failed to request Ironic to provision instance "
                     "%(inst)s: %(reason)s") % {'inst': instance['uuid'],
                                                'reason': str(e)})
            LOG.error(msg)
            self._cleanup_deploy(node, instance, network_info)

If exception happens inside _cleanup_deploy, it will hide the original one. excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() should be used here.
